detaileddescription.para: Title: P01003: Characterisation of the red gurnard fisheries in GUR 2

Principal Investigator: Nathan Walker Researchers: Terese Kendrick Status: Completed Trophia was contracted by the New Zealand Ministry of Fisheries (MFish) to characterise the red gurnard ( Chelidonichthys kumu ) fishery in GUR 2 and those of associated species taken by the Area 2 inshore trawl fishery by analysis of existing commercial catch and effort data and data from other sources; and make recommendations on appropriate methods to monitor or assess the status of individual Fishstocks or groups of species combined This project was funded by the New Zealand Ministry of Fisheries Project GUR2001/01 Outputs include presentation of results to a meeting of the Ministry of Fisheries Inshore Working Group. A Final Research Report, is now available from this site: Kendrick, T.H.; Walker, N.A. (2004). Characterisation of the GUR 2 red gurnard (Chelidonichthys kumu) and associated inshore trawl fisheries, 1989�90 to 2000�01. New Zealand Fisheries Assessment Report 2004/21. 83p. Download document
